action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.

DESCRIPTION: Two people in wetsuits are standing on a sandy beach facing the ocean. One person is holding a surfboard, and the other has a surfboard on the ground. The ocean waves are visible in the background.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.

DESCRIPTION: Two people in wetsuits are standing on a beach facing the ocean. One person is holding a surfboard, and the other has a bodyboard on the ground. The ocean waves are visible in the background.

This is my DESCRIPTION: Two people in wetsuits are standing on a sandy beach facing the ocean. One person is holding a surfboard, and the other has a surfboard on the ground. The ocean waves are visible in the background.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are both people in your image holding surfboards?

This is my DESCRIPTION: Two people in wetsuits are standing on a beach facing the ocean. One person is holding a surfboard, and the other has a bodyboard on the ground. The ocean waves are visible in the background.
QUESTION: Are both people in your image holding surfboards? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the beach in your image sandy?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: Is the beach in your image sandy? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is one of the people in your image holding a bodyboard?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Is one of the people in your image holding a bodyboard? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are the people in your image facing away from the camera?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Are the people in your image facing away from the camera? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the person holding the bodyboard standing closer to the water than the person holding the surfboard?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Is the person holding the bodyboard standing closer to the water than the person holding the surfboard? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the person holding the surfboard on the left side of the image?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Is the person holding the surfboard on the left side of the image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.
